persona_description: A visually driven minimalist who prioritizes openness, simplicity, and clean sightlines. This user prefers items to be removed from the floor but dislikes overusing storage furniture, favoring accessible and visually balanced arrangements over strict categorization.
perference: Items should be removed from the floor to make the living room look clean and open.
Decorative objects such as plants should be displayed on visible furniture surfaces.
Lightweight paper items should remain easily accessible rather than hidden away.
The living room should prioritize visual simplicity over dense storage.
Storage furniture should be used minimally to avoid a cluttered appearance.
